segment.source: Perform Proxy Activation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Perform Proxy Activation (Windows 10)

segment.source: Perform Proxy Activation
segment.target: Perform Proxy Activation

segment.source: Perform Proxy Activation
segment.target: Perform Proxy Activation

segment.source: You can use the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) to perform activation for client computers that do not have Internet access.
segment.target: You can use the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) to perform activation for client computers that do not have Internet access.

segment.source: The client products can be installed with any type of product key that is eligible for proxy activation: Multiple activation Key (MAK), KMS Host key (CSVLK), or retail key.
segment.target: The client products can be installed with any type of product key that is eligible for proxy activation: Multiple activation Key (MAK), KMS Host key (CSVLK), or retail key.

segment.source: In a typical proxy-activation scenario, the VAMT host computer distributes a MAK to one or more client computers and collects the installation ID (IID) from each computer.
segment.target: In a typical proxy-activation scenario, the VAMT host computer distributes a MAK to one or more client computers and collects the installation ID (IID) from each computer.

segment.source: The VAMT host computer sends the IIDs to Microsoft on behalf of the client computers and obtains the corresponding Confirmation IDs (CIDs).
segment.target: The VAMT host computer sends the IIDs to Microsoft on behalf of the client computers and obtains the corresponding Confirmation IDs (CIDs).

segment.source: The VAMT host computer then installs the CIDs on the client computer to complete the activation.
segment.target: The VAMT host computer then installs the CIDs on the client computer to complete the activation.

segment.source: Using this activation method, only the VAMT host computer needs Internet access.
segment.target: Using this activation method, only the VAMT host computer needs Internet access.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For workgroups that are completely isolated from any larger network, you can still perform MAK, KMS Host key (CSVLK), or retail proxy activation.
segment.target: For workgroups that are completely isolated from any larger network, you can still perform MAK, KMS Host key (CSVLK), or retail proxy activation.

segment.source: This requires installing a second instance of VAMT on a computer within the isolated group and using removable media to transfer activation data between that computer and another VAMT host computer that has Internet access.
segment.target: This requires installing a second instance of VAMT on a computer within the isolated group and using removable media to transfer activation data between that computer and another VAMT host computer that has Internet access.

segment.source: For more information about this scenario, see Scenario 2: Proxy Activation.
segment.target: For more information about this scenario, see Scenario 2: Proxy Activation.

segment.source: Similarly, you can proxy activate a KMS Host key (CSVLK) located in an isolated network.
segment.target: Similarly, you can proxy activate a KMS Host key (CSVLK) located in an isolated network.

segment.source: You can also proxy activate a KMS Host key (CSVLK) in the core network if you do not want the KMS host computer to connect to Microsoft over the Internet.
segment.target: You can also proxy activate a KMS Host key (CSVLK) in the core network if you do not want the KMS host computer to connect to Microsoft over the Internet.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Before performing proxy activation, ensure that your network and the VAMT installation meet the following requirements:
segment.target: Before performing proxy activation, ensure that your network and the VAMT installation meet the following requirements:

segment.source: There is an instance of VAMT that is installed on a computer that has Internet access.
segment.target: There is an instance of VAMT that is installed on a computer that has Internet access.

segment.source: If you are performing proxy activation for an isolated workgroup, you also need to have VAMT installed on one of the computers in the workgroup.
segment.target: If you are performing proxy activation for an isolated workgroup, you also need to have VAMT installed on one of the computers in the workgroup.

segment.source: The products to be activated have been added to VAMT and are installed with a retail product key, a KMS Host key (CSVLK) or a MAK.
segment.target: The products to be activated have been added to VAMT and are installed with a retail product key, a KMS Host key (CSVLK) or a MAK.

segment.source: If the products have not been installed with a proper product key, refer to the steps in the Add and Remove a Product Key section for instructions on how to install a product key.
segment.target: If the products have not been installed with a proper product key, refer to the steps in the Add and Remove a Product Key section for instructions on how to install a product key.

segment.source: VAMT has administrative permissions on all products to be activated and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) is accessible through the Windows firewall.
segment.target: VAMT has administrative permissions on all products to be activated and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) is accessible through the Windows firewall.

segment.source: For workgroup computers, a registry key must be created to enable remote administrative actions under User Account Control (UAC).
segment.target: For workgroup computers, a registry key must be created to enable remote administrative actions under User Account Control (UAC).

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.

segment.source: The product keys that are installed on the client products must have a sufficient number of remaining activations.
segment.target: The product keys that are installed on the client products must have a sufficient number of remaining activations.

segment.source: If you are activating a MAK key, you can retrieve the remaining number of activations for that key by selecting the MAK in the product key list in the center pane and then clicking Refresh product key data online in the right-side pane.
segment.target: If you are activating a MAK key, you can retrieve the remaining number of activations for that key by selecting the MAK in the product key list in the center pane and then clicking Refresh product key data online in the right-side pane.

segment.source: This retrieves the number of remaining activations for the MAK from Microsoft.
segment.target: This retrieves the number of remaining activations for the MAK from Microsoft.

segment.source: Note that this step requires Internet access and that the remaining activation count can only be retrieved for MAKs.
segment.target: Note that this step requires Internet access and that the remaining activation count can only be retrieved for MAKs.

segment.source: To Perform Proxy Activation
segment.target: To Perform Proxy Activation

segment.source: To perform proxy activation
segment.target: To perform proxy activation

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: If necessary, install product keys.
segment.target: If necessary, install product keys.

segment.source: For more information see:
segment.target: For more information see:

segment.source: Install a Product Key to install retail, MAK, or KMS Host key (CSVLK).
segment.target: Install a Product Key to install retail, MAK, or KMS Host key (CSVLK).

segment.source: Install a KMS Client Key to install GVLK (KMS client) keys.
segment.target: Install a KMS Client Key to install GVLK (KMS client) keys.

segment.source: In the Products list in the center pane, select the individual products to be activated.
segment.target: In the Products list in the center pane, select the individual products to be activated.

segment.source: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for products by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.
segment.target: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for products by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.

segment.source: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.
segment.target: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.

segment.source: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.
segment.target: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.

segment.source: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.
segment.target: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.

segment.source: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.
segment.target: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.

segment.source: Click Filter.
segment.target: Click Filter.

segment.source: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.
segment.target: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.

segment.source: In the right-side pane, click Activate and then click Proxy activate to open the Proxy Activate dialog box.
segment.target: In the right-side pane, click Activate and then click Proxy activate to open the Proxy Activate dialog box.

segment.source: In the Proxy Activate dialog box click Apply Confirmation ID, apply to selected machine(s) and activate.
segment.target: In the Proxy Activate dialog box click Apply Confirmation ID, apply to selected machine(s) and activate.

segment.source: If you are activating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you are currently using, select the Use Alternate Credentials checkbox.
segment.target: If you are activating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you are currently using, select the Use Alternate Credentials checkbox.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Activating products dialog box until it completes the requested action.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Activating products dialog box until it completes the requested action.

segment.source: If you selected the Alternate Credentials option, you will be prompted to enter the credentials.
segment.target: If you selected the Alternate Credentials option, you will be prompted to enter the credentials.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can use proxy activation to select products that have different key types and activate the products at the same time.
segment.target: You can use proxy activation to select products that have different key types and activate the products at the same time.
